str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A couch, bed, portable bed or mat, a couch for reclining at meals, possibly also a bier. From klino; a couch.
And, even, also, namely.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Afflicted with paralysis. From a derivative of paraluo; as if dissolved, i.e. 'paralytic'.

str2: To be of good courage, good cheer, be bold. From tharsos; to have courage.

str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
